body: I have tried to plot confusion matrix as an image and then save that image as an artifact. This is something i found to be useful.
@whiletruelearn yes it partly works and I tried it as well, but in contrast to metrics (e.g. `cm_{true}_{pred}`), I couldn't compare different runs matrices and their dynamics.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
I also wonder if it exist a way of store and compare the confusion matrices as metrics in ml_flow, to be compared among experiments. Does anyone know if this is possible?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

> I'd like to be able to monitor dynamics of confusion matrix, And have tried to store it element-wise (`cm_{true}_{pred}`) to be able to monitor dynamics by epoch and be able to compare with other experiments. But in case of multiple classes (in my case it's 10) it becomes very huge metrics mlflow table, and breaks UX.
> 
> What is the recommended way to log confusion matrix metrics? Can I group metrics so be able to collapse/expand them?

This would do it.
cm = confusion_matrix(y, y_pred)
t_n, f_p, f_n, t_p = cm.ravel() 
mlflow.log_metric("tn", t_n)
mlflow.log_metric("fp", f_p)
mlflow.log_metric("fn", f_n)
mlflow.log_metric("tp", t_p)
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!
@2mariya yes, I usually do that way but it somehow work only in case of binary classification, but quickly becomes inefficient when number of classes grows
Is there any solution for this issue yet?
